Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Peer Reviewer, Russian Journal of Linguistics (Vestnik Rudn)
Russian Journal of Linguistics (Vestnik Rudn), Member of Editorial Board. Currently editing special edition on Discourse Analysis for issue in December 2016.
Peer Reviewer for BRNO Studies in English

Reviewer for Journal of Language and Politics. Titles reviewed: -Kratochvíl, P. and Doležal, T. 2015 (London, Palgrave Macmillan). The European Union and the Catholic Church. Political theology of European integration, accepted for publication in Volume 15, Issue 5, December 2016. -Stoian, C. The discourse of tourism and national heritage, expected publication in 2017.

Reviewer for Discourse and Society. Published review of Chovanec, J. Pragmatics of time and tense in news . DISCOURSE & SOCIETY 2016, vol. 27, p. 351-352, ISSN: 0957-9265, doi: 10.1177/0957926516629754

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: - When is it reasonable to co-operate? Discourse Analysis and Contemporary Social Change. University of Palermo. May 2005
- An end to Fox-hunting. XXII Conference AIA, Cityscapes Islands of the Self. University of Cagliari. September 2005

- Margaret Thatcher and the female stereotype. Us and Them – Them and Us: Constructions of the Other in Cultural Stereotypes – Perceptions, Challenges, Meanings. University of Szczecin, Poland.May 2009.
- The female political leader: gender identity in the case of Margaret Thatcher. 21st European Systemic Functional Linguistics Conference and Workshop. Cardiff University, Wales. July 2009.
- How polite was she? Interactions with Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher. XXIV AIA National Convention. University of Roma Tre. October 2009.

- What’s in a (Brazilian shirt) name? Discursive issues involved in achieving membership of a community of radio listeners. Personal Identity through a language lens. University of Lodz, Poland. May 2010.
- To die for a lie? The penalty at Tannadice: a study of appraisal in the area of honesty. Cross-cultural pragmatics at a crossroads. University of East Anglia. June 2011.
- What did I do to be so white and blue? Metrics, music and mind. Linguistic, Metrical and Cognitive Implications in Sung Verse. University “La Sapienza”, Rome February 2012.
- The (royal) man in the street? A study of mediated identity. Invited speaker at workshop on discursive construction of identity. University of Szczecin, Poland. June 2012.
- All you need is Lennon. Love and other ideals in the songs of the Beatles. (Invited speaker) Omaggio ai Beatles e a John Lennon, Centro Studi F. Rossitto. Ragusa 11.01.2013.
- The British royal family identity: distance and closeness. I-Mean 3: Language and Identity. Bristol University. April 2013.
- Insider or outsider? Face in a modern Buddhist movement. Cross-cultural pragmatics at a crossroads III. University of East Anglia. June 2013.
- The poetry of Stuart Hall. Remaking the genre of the football match report. XXVI AIA Conference. University of Parma. September 2013.
- Friendship in the digital age. Negotiating Cultural Differences in the Digital Communication Era. Jagiellonian University, Krakow, Poland. October 2013.
- Saving face, or winning a case? Issues of face and identity construction in mediation. 3rd International Conference Language and Law in Social Practice, University of Naples. May 2014.
- Malcolm X and the pragmatics of argumentation. 6th International Conference on Intercultural Pragmatics and Communication. University of Malta. June 2014.
- Translating the woman in Sicilian proverbs: searching for equivalence. 2nd International Conference, Languaging Diversity. University of Catania. October 2014.
- Metaphors for Europe. UKIP’s use of verbal and visual metaphor. Annual Convention of the Italian Association of Political Communication. University of Catania. December 2014.
- The case of Oxford: how the language of a British university is impacted by globalisation. XXVII AIA Convention. University of Naples. September 2015.

- The word and the world. The environment in British political discourse. (Invited speaker). Kuskovskaya Chtenija. Themes of textual criticism: tradition and innovation. Moscow City University of Psychology and Education. September 2015.
- A Natural choice? Metaphors for nature in a UK government white paper. (invited speaker) Seminar at the People’s Friendship University of Russia. Moscow. September 2016.
- Representing Corbyn: responses of the British media to the new Labour leader. International conference: Potere e Società: Leadership, partiti e movimenti. University of Catania. October 2015.
- Siracusa: Italy’s smartest city? A (critical) ecolinguistic perspective. International conference: Ecolinguisticum, Graz, Austria. October 2015.
- Resisting dislocation in emigration: the case of Texas Tavola. (Invited speaker) Dislocating people(s) and cultures. Università degli Studi Federico II, Naples. January 2016.
- De-industrializzazione e controversie ambientali nel mezzogiorno di Italia. Round table. University of Catania, Department of Political and Social Sciences. March 2016.
- Teaching Conversation through conversation: a case study from Italy. Skype “Young Scientists in Metropolitan Education.” The XV Moscow Scientific Conference of Young Scientists. April 2016.
- Siracusa, tourism and the Smart City discourse. CERLIS: Ways of seeing, ways of being: representing the voices of tourism. University of Bergamo, June 2016.

- How sustainable is the concept of ‘sustainability’ in the tourism market? 5th Critical Approaches to Discourse Analysis Across Disciplines (CADAAD) conference, University of Catania, September 2016.
- Panel Organiser: “Critical approaches to sustainability”. 5th Critical Approaches to Discourse Analysis Across Disciplines (CADAAD) conference, University of Catania, September 2016.
- Mediating Siracusa in Tourist Discourse. "Trans-mediating Cultures" Szczecin University, Poland, November 2016.

- International Conference on Language and Emotion, National University of Distance Education, Madrid, Spain Co-authored the paper "The article review genre: an intercultural perspective on stance, emotion and politeness" with Professor Tatiana Larina (did not attend the conference)

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Ministero Italiano dell’Università e Ricerca (MIUR): member of the Albo Revisori (Board of Reviewers) for evaluating funded project proposals.
Ministro Italiano dell'Università e Ricerca (MIUR): assessor of academic quality of papers produced in Italy (Valutazione Qualitativa della Ricerca).

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Award from the Russian Journal of Linguistics for contributions to Political Discourse Analysis: £1500.

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: XXIX Ciclo Dottorato di ricerca in Scienze Politiche e Sociali

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Callan School of English, London. English language teaching and research into the practical application of the Direct Method.
University of Durham, UK, English for Academic Purposes, pre-sessional course. Teaching Academic English.
Visiting Professor Peoples' Friendship University of Russia, Lecture on "Metaphors for Nature in the UK government's 2010 white paper 'the value of nature'.

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Training in non-verbal communication for teachers (20 hours). Liceo Linguistico J.F. Kennedy, Ispica
Diploma in TESOL from Trinity College, London. Language learning and teaching methodology, grammar, pronunciation, lesson and materials design, language testing.

Between 2003 and 2008 I completed a Masters (MSc) in TESOL from Aston University, Birmingham, England. Research in this course included classroom methodology, spoken and written elements of English, Systemic Functional Linguistics, language testing, syllabus and course design and discourse analysis.

Centro Studi Americani, Roma; Bibliographic Apprenticeship; methodologies and techniques of bibliographic research (40 hours), as part of the doctoral programme in English and American Studies, University of Catania

Aston University, Birmingham. Study week as part of MSc programme in TESOL. Group tutors Sue Garton, Julian Edge and Keith Richards. Individual study sessions with Ramesh Krishnamurty, Christina Schäffner, and Norman Fairclough.
Edinburgh, Herriot-Watt University: EAP Teacher Development Course (English for Academic Purposes), 40 hours.
Course of creative writing at the University of Middlesex, England. Teacher: Sara Boyes (30 hours)

Research Project funded by the University of Catania, Department of Political and Social Sciences: "Identity and the bounds of community. A linguistic perspective" (no formal end term to this project)
Research project funded by the University of Catania, Department of Political and Social Sciences: “Analyzing modern political rhetoric.” (no formal end to this project)

Research project on the language of football, producing the paper "Football stories: football match reports from a narrative and stylistic perspective" to be published as part of the XXVI AIA Conference 2013, University of Parma, conference proceedings.

Research project on the sociolinguistics of religious discourse, producing the paper: "Inside the tower: membership and face in a modern Buddhist group", published in the Journal of Language and Literature, 2014.

Research project on critical discourse analysis of environmental discourse, producing the paper "Global warming and the role of language in social transformation", published in Language and Text, 2014.

Research project on the language of sport, producing the paper "Royal sport and social distance: television interviews with Prince Andrew and Princess Anne", published in the International Journal of Language Studies, 2014.

Research project on intercultural sociolinguistics, producing the paper "The pragmatics of the handshake: a politeness index in British and Italian use", published in Vestnik Rudn, the Russian Journal of Linguistics, 2014

Research project on Oxford University and the language of globalisation, producing a paper: "Oxford University and globalisation: re-branding the dreaming spires", presented at the XXVII AIA Conference, University Federico II of Naples, to be published as part of the conference proceedings.
Collaboration with Prof. Asero Vincenzo on paper: The Montalbano effect: re-branding Sicily as a tourist destination? Published in ON THE HORIZON VOL. 23 NO. 4 2015, pp. 342-351.
Sociolinguistic research project on the language of football, producing the paper: Moving the generic goalposts? The ‘poetry’ of Stuart Hall, published in Soccer and Society 03 Aug 2015.
Training course for Cambridge ESOL examiners. The English Academy, Siracusa. Language testing, grammar knowledge, pronunciation, interactive communication.

As part of the FIR project "Smart Assemblages: Frictions, Disasters and Green Economy" (University of Catania 2014- the present), produced the paper Siracusa: Italy’s smartest city? Re-branding issues from a critical ecolinguistic perspective. Published online in Language and Ecology, 2016.

Following my presentation of the paper "Teaching Conversation through conversation: a case study from Italy" via Skype at the “Young Scientists in Metropolitan Education, the XVth Moscow Scientific Conference of Young Scientists" in April 2016, the paper will be published in December 2016 edition of Humanising Language Teaching.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Progetto FIR “Smart Assemblages: Frictions, Disasters and Green Economy” (interdisciplinary project - Anthropology, Ethnography, Geography, Economics) investigating Smart City discourse in the city of Siracusa.
PRIN: PROGETTI DI RICERCA DI RILEVANTE INTERESSE NAZIONALE – Bando 2015 Prot. 20155TYKCM
